intro: Ranunculus × novae-forestae, commonly known as the Forest Garden Buttercup, is a hybrid perennial plant native to the United Kingdom. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features trifoliate leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its early spring bloom and delicate appearance.
